Event:
The poster shares their struggles with depression, anxiety, and emotional abuse in a past relationship. They also mention feeling lost and disconnected from friends and family, as well as their efforts to keep busy through work, studies, and gymming. Finally, they express their longing for girl B and their decision to cut ties with girl A.

Main Event: The poster's struggles with depression, anxiety, and emotional abuse, as well as their feelings of disconnection from friends and family, and their desire to move on from girl A and focus on improving their mental health.
Post: "Struggling to find my footing in a world that feels like it's crumbling beneath me. Depression, anxiety, and emotional abuse have taken their toll, leaving me feeling lost and disconnected from friends and family. I've tried to keep busy through work, studies, and gymming, but the ache in my heart remains. Girl B, you're my solace, my sanctuary. My decision to cut ties with girl A was the hardest thing I've ever had to do, but I know it's the only way to heal and move forward. #MentalHealthMatters #SelfCare #Healing"

Event: Trying to have a baby for the last 4 years and experiencing several miscarriages, as well as feeling a void in one's heart due to not having a baby despite everyone else on social media having one.
Post: "Feeling like a failure as a woman, I've been trying to conceive for four long years, but all I have to show for it are a handful of miscarriages and an ache in my heart that refuses to subside. While everyone else on social media seems to be overflowing with baby joy, I can't help but wonder if there's something fundamentally wrong with me."

Event: The user is worried about the potential sexual side effects of Citalopram (Celexa), specifically delayed ejaculation and loss of interest in sex.
Post: "I'm concerned about the potential sexual side effects of Citalopram (Celexa). I've heard it can cause delayed ejaculation and a loss of interest in sex. I'm worried that this medication will affect my ability to connect with others intimately."

Event: Prescribed medication (Paxil) had negative effects on the individual's mental state, causing increased anxiety and depression.
Post: "Feeling like a prisoner in my own mind, I'm forced to confront the harsh reality that the medication prescribed to help me is actually making things worse. The Paxil-induced haze only seems to intensify my anxiety and depression. Is this what it means to be 'cured'?"

Event: The individual has been facing difficult life circumstances, including having a disabled mother who relies on SSI, a father with paranoid schizophrenia who has never worked, and a brother who is violent and angry. The individual themselves experiences anxiety, depression, possible Asperger's, hearing loss, and tinnitus, and has written suicide notes as a coping mechanism. They are struggling to make ends meet and find purpose in their life, with a desire for a partner and a shared interest in film.
Post: "Struggling to make ends meet and find purpose in my life, I'm faced with the harsh reality of my difficult circumstances. Despite my best efforts, I'm haunted by the thought that I may never escape the shadows of my family's struggles. My disabled mother relies on SSI, my father's paranoid schizophrenia has left him unable to work, and my violent and angry brother casts a dark shadow over my life. I've tried to cope with anxiety, depression, possible Asperger's, hearing loss, and tinnitus, but it's hard to find hope when suicide notes have become my only solace. My desire for a partner and a shared interest in film feels like a distant dream, a luxury I may never be able to afford. Maybe it's me, maybe I'm just not meant to be happy."

Event: Getting refills on antidepressant medication.
Post: "Feeling like a failure for needing refills on my antidepressant meds. Guess I'll never be truly happy."

Event: Psychological testing conducted by a psychologist to ensure no underlying issues are missed, taking two 8-hour days.

Feeling both validated and empowered to take control of my mental health. Time to level up my self-care game! 💪🏼 #ADHD #MentalHealthMatters #SelfCare"

Event: Medication seems like an insidious trap with negative experiences, side effects, and anecdotes overwhelmingly outweighing the best-case scenarios of people finding a medication without side effects and slowly stepping off it after experiencing improvement.

Event:
The individual has been diagnosed with various mental health conditions, including schizophrenia, schizoaffective disorder, and bipolar disorder. They have experienced psychotic episodes, depression, and suicidal thoughts, and have undergone various treatments, including ECT, medications, and therapy.

The main event in this passage is the individual's experience with ECT. The passage mentions that the individual was arrested and involuntarily held in a hospital after taking one medicine, and that they eventually had ECT after experiencing suicidal thoughts. This event had a significant impact on the individual's mental health, as it helped to alleviate their psychotic depression and suicidal thoughts.
Post: "I was arrested and involuntarily hospitalized after taking one medicine, but little did I know that it would lead to a life-changing experience - ECT. It's scary to think that my mind could play such tricks on me, making me feel like I'm not good enough, but I'm grateful for the treatment that helped alleviate my psychotic depression and suicidal thoughts. Maybe I'll never be fully cured, but I'm learning to love myself more each day." #IAS #MentalHealthAwareness

Event:
Feeling down 90/95% of the time
Having an annoying tingly feeling in my intensities every morning when waking up
Having a negative thought pattern and always looking back on events and thinking negatively
Avoiding social situations
Taking drugs (alcohol, ghb, 2cb, nitrous, speed, 4fmp, xtc, mdma, cocaine, ketamine) every weekend
Feeling sad and considering calling a psychologist for social anxiety and anger attacks.
Post: "Feeling down 90/95% of the time, I can't help but wonder if it's just my natural disposition. Am I just wired to be negative? Every morning I wake up with this annoying tingly feeling in my intensities. It's like my body is trying to tell me something, but what? That I'm not good enough? That I'll never be happy? And don't even get me started on my thought patterns. Always looking back on events and thinking negatively. It's like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of self-doubt. Even social situations are a struggle. I avoid them at all costs, fearing rejection or judgment. And when I do muster up the courage to go out, I turn to drugs (alcohol, ghb, 2cb, nitrous, speed, 4fmp, xtc, mdma, cocaine, ketamine) every weekend just to cope. But let's be real, that's not a healthy coping mechanism. Maybe it's time I face my demons and consider calling a psychologist for social anxiety and anger attacks. Maybe then I can start to pick up the pieces of my shattered self-worth."
